title: Business & Finance
text:
---

China set an economic growth target for the year of around 5.5%, the lowest level in more than a quarter-century of economic planning, reflecting heightened domestic and global uncertainties.

---

Markets capped a week that saw giant swings across currencies and stocks around the world and commodities prices soaring the most in decades. The S&P 500 and Dow both fell 1.3% for the week, while the Nasdaq lost 2.8%.

---

The Justice Department is investigating whether poultry companies have engaged in anticompetitive sharing about employment practices that held down plant workers' wages.

---

Honda and Sony said they are teaming up to build electric vehicles.

---

Walt Disney said it would roll out a cheaper, ad-supported Disney + subscription in the U.S. in late 2022.
